thread.title: Colorado DMV services could be outsourced
thread.title_full: Colorado DMV services could be outsourced

title: Colorado DMV services could be outsourced
text:
Long lines drive Colorado lawmakers to eye outsourcing DMV services Joey Bunch, Denver Post 11:37 PM, Oct 12, 2015 34 mins ago denver | colorado | dmv | outsourcing DENVER, CO - OCTOBER 07: People wait to be helped at a driver's license office in west Denver, October 07, 2015. The Colorado legislature is looking at a plan to outsource some of the Department of Motor Vehicle services to retailers in order to reduce lines and wait times at state offices. (Photo by RJ Sangosti/The Denver Post) RJ Sangosti Copyright - 2015 The Denver Post, MediaNews Group. Show Caption Previous Next 
Just after lunchtime Wednesday, Jeffrey Jordan of Wheat Ridge was running late to get back to work. He hoped to make a quick trip to the state Division of Motor Vehicles office in Lakewood. No such luck. The wait took an hour in the crowded, busy office. 
"I would drive an hour if it meant I wouldn't have to wait in line," he said, after picking up a copy of his vehicle registration. 
If a draft bill put forth by the Colorado legislature's joint transportation committee passes during next year's legislative session, he might be able to avoid the wait by visiting a retailer instead. 
At least 18 states outsource some of their DMV services to established retailers for vehicle registrations, driver's licenses and renewals, according to the America Association of Motor Vehicle Administrators. At least 10 states hire private contractors to do driving tests for licenses, as well. 
Twelve states use the motor club AAA, but Colorado's proposed legislation doesn't single out a vendor, even though AAA suggested the idea for Colorado, Sen. Ray Scott, R-Grand Junction, told the Transportation Legislation Review Committee. 
Read the full report from The Denver Post . Denver Post
